repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio Grande do Norte Integrated
            Water Resources Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Rio Grande do Norte
            Integrated Water Resources Management Project for Brazil was
            as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk to
            development outcome was substantial, Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            streamlined projects with focused activities may prove
            easier for low-capacity Borrowers to implement.
            Institutional reforms require strong commitment and priority
            from the government. Ensuring institutional capacity to
            sustain results, both in terms of institutional change and
            infrastructural improvements, must start at preparation.
            Stakeholder and partner input during preparation may not be
            sufficient to create a sustainable participatory process.
            Integration of co-executing agencies is essential for
            efficient execution. When strengthening the landscape
            restoration aspect and increasing environmental and economic
            benefits, replication initiatives should include
            complementary actions to restore riparian vegetation, as
            well as to delimit, formalize, and restore permanent
            preservation areas and legal reserves within the watershed.
            When irrigation perimeters rely on multi-purpose reservoirs,
            it is essential to establish criteria and conditions for
            negotiated water allocation.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Rio Grande do Norte Integrated
            Water Resources Management Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The higher level objective of the
            project is to promote economic, social, and environmentally
            sustainable development through the implementation of an
            integrated water resources management system. This
            restructuring paper makes the following changes to the
            project: a) extension of 14 months for closing date, from
            November 30, 2012 to March 31, 2014; b) reallocation of loan
            proceeds among its categories; and c) adjustment of project
            targets and indicators to ensure that these are measurable
            within the timeframe for completion and in line with the
            priority activities being supported by the project. The main
            reasons for these changes are: 1) delays in start up and
            implementation of activities; 2) changes in the state
            government administration resulting in major changes in the
            implementing agency teams; 3) exchange rate losses; 4)
            increase in project costs due to the gap between preparation
            and implementation and to the heating of the Brazilian
            market caused by investment programs launched by the Federal
            government; and 5) need for better alignment of activities
            prioritized within the scope of the project to the amount of
            available funding.

display_title.display_title:
Brazil - Rio Grande do Norte
            Integrated Water Resources Management Project :
            restructuring : Main report
